private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and no larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves to reach the global goal configuration by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I control.

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and no larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves to reach the global goal configuration by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I control.

private_information: I can move disks: K, L, M, N, O
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and no larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves to reach the global goal configuration by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I control.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' proposed primitive moves, verify legality, and produce a consolidated PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards planner that encodes the final plan and global goal.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi instance with 3 pegs named left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) B, C, D; right peg has (top->bottom) A.
Valid primitive move format: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
Tower of Hanoi rules must be respected: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: get to {environment->public_information[3]}. Provide a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, limited to disks A-E, consistent with the public information and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can only move disks F, G, H, I, J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: get to {environment->public_information[3]}. Provide a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, limited to disks F-J, consistent with the public information and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can only move disks K, L, M, N, O. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: get to {environment->public_information[3]}. Provide a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, limited to disks K-O, consistent with the public information and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the three agents' ordered lists of primitive moves. Verify and, if necessary, reorder or annotate moves so the global sequence is legal under Tower of Hanoi constraints. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the initial state and the goal configuration and that represent the consolidated legal plan. The PDDL must be suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You will receive: {workflow->orchestrator->pddl->input}. Integrate these move lists into a single legal plan achieving the global goal: {environment->public_information[3]}. Output the PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards, keeping agent move actions distinct where applicable. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
